channel.title: Non-static variable from a static context
channel.description:
I have a prestige system I'm implementing in to my Project No-Doze source, and I got this error:
src\com\rs2\model\player\packetmanager\packets\ActionButtons.java:45: non-static variable prestige cannot be referenced from a static context client.getActionSender().sendMessage("Prestige: " + Play erDetails.prestige + ", Prestige Rank: " + PlayerDetails.prestigeRank + ".");
Now I understand that my prestige will be changing all the time (dynamic), but I don't understand the context. I've imported PlayerDetails and used PlayerDetails.prestige. Here's what I've declared in Playerdetails: There's two public String's, one with "[]". prestigeRank is at the bottom. [code=java] public String username, password, ConnectedFrom; public String[] lastKilled, prestigeRank; [/code] There are also two types of public int's. prestige is at the bottom. [code=java] public int absX, absY, heightLevel, hitpoints, friendsSize, playerBankSize, ignoresSize, specialAmount, poisonDelay, poisonDamage, skullTimer, pkPoints, energy, dharokDamage, spellBook, combatMode, lastMeleeMode, lastRangeMode, starter, ID, running; public int[] playerItem, playerItemN, playerEquipment, playerEquipmentN, playerLevel, playerXP, bankItems, bankItemsN, playerLook, prestige; [/code] Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated, even if it's just an idea. Thanks for reading.

item.title: Non-static variable from a static context
item.dc:creator: @_onster мonster
item.description:
@_onster wrote:

That’s what the compiler tells me, hence my post. :o

So tell me this, does “PlayerDetails.prestige” make it static?

Read full topic
item.source: Non-static variable from a static context

item.title: Non-static variable from a static context
item.dc:creator: @_onster мonster
item.description:
@_onster wrote:

I have a prestige system I’m implementing in to my Project No-Doze source, and I got this error:

src\com\rs2\model\player\packetmanager\packets\ActionButtons.java:45: non-static variable prestige cannot be referenced from a static context client.getActionSender().sendMessage("Prestige: " + Play erDetails.prestige + ", Prestige Rank: " + PlayerDetails.prestigeRank + ".");

Now I understand that my prestige will be changing all the time (dynamic), but I don’t understand the context.

I’ve imported PlayerDetails and used PlayerDetails.prestige.

Here’s what I’ve declared in Playerdetails:

There’s two public String’s, one with “[]”. prestigeRank is at the bottom.

public String username, password, ConnectedFrom;
    	public String[] lastKilled, prestigeRank;

There are also two types of public int’s. prestige is at the bottom.

public int 
		absX, absY, heightLevel, hitpoints, friendsSize, 
		playerBankSize, ignoresSize, specialAmount, 
		poisonDelay, poisonDamage, skullTimer, pkPoints, energy, 
		dharokDamage, spellBook, combatMode, 
		lastMeleeMode, lastRangeMode, starter, ID, running;
	
	public int[] 
	    playerItem, playerItemN, playerEquipment, 
	   	playerEquipmentN, playerLevel, playerXP, 
	   	bankItems, bankItemsN, playerLook, prestige;

Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated, even if it’s just an idea.

Thanks for reading.

Read full topic
item.source: Non-static variable from a static context
